name: National Disability Insurance Scheme (NDIS) – Assistive Technology & Employment Support
description: NDIS provides funding for Australians with disabilities to access assistive technology, job coaching, and workplace modifications. It can help cover adaptive equipment and support services for remote work.
eligibility: Permanent and significant disability (mobility impairment qualifies)
benefits: Funding for adaptive technology, job coaching, and workplace accessibility; personalized support plans.
applicationSteps: Check eligibility and gather medical documentation
Register and apply via the NDIS website or call center
Attend a planning meeting to discuss needs and goals

name: Australian Computer Society (ACS) – Remote Software Developer Job Board
description: ACS offers a curated job board with remote and flexible software developer roles, including positions with inclusive employers committed to accessibility.
eligibility: Relevant IT degree (Master of Computer Science qualifies)
benefits: Access to remote, flexible jobs; employers with disability inclusion policies; networking and mentoring opportunities.
applicationSteps: Register for free ACS membership (student or graduate tier)
Set up job alerts for remote/flexible roles

name: University of Sydney – Disability Support Scholarship
description: A scholarship for postgraduate students with disabilities, supporting living and study costs. Open to students with mobility impairments.
eligibility: Enrolled in postgraduate study at University of Sydney
benefits: Financial support (up to $7,000); access to campus accessibility resources; priority for assistive technology loans.
